text: I’m getting weird behavior/editor errors when uploading a footer that includes a standard `@HubSpot/menu` module. This happens on upload in multiple portals
screenshots explain. But editor says error in flyouts boolean value, but shows error on max level field :thinking_face:

Haven’t run into this specific error, but I’ve been having a LOT of trouble with the global content editor in the last week — and part of it has been random issues with field validation that I’ve just had to wait out. So, it could be something to do with that.

However, I do have *one* odd hunch that might be worth looking into: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags#menu|the documentation for the HubL Menu Tag> passes the value for the `flyouts` property as a string, rather than a boolean.

It’s likely nonsense, but it might be worth trying if nothing else seems to cut it.

I've been having this issue yesterday and today and I think there's a caching issue because if I wait a while (like half a day at least), it just starts to work :woman-shrugging:

Glad I'm not the only one!
